intro: Achoriphragma maidantalicum, commonly known as the Maltese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Malta. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, showing a preference for well-drained soils. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
